column1: On Thanksgiving Wisconsin reported over 200 new hospitalizations.  We need the state legislature to meet and support the Governor's mask & occupancy orders.  We the need the state to expand testing and hire more contact tracers.  We need the @SenateGOP to pass COVID relief NOW. https://t.co/w6TyktzuAK
Wisconsin COVID-19 is raging across our state and there's a lot ALL of us can do still to help stop the spread.  This is URGENT: https://t.co/r9qtieYtSZ

104 Wisconsinites died from COVID today.  About 10% of all U.S. COVID deaths today happened in WI.  The state leg must take action & support the Gov's mask & occupancy orders.  The state must expand testing & hire more contact tracers.  The @SenateGOP must pass COVID relief NOW. https://t.co/U2iWlp2rX1

So the Senator that possibly profited off of COVID-19 also possibly profited off lucrative defense contractor deals?  Is this what the @SenateGOP is busy doing instead of passing COVID relief? https://t.co/50Win7LtCP
Over 18600 Americans have died from COVID in the time it has taken Donald Trump to "accept" the results of this election. https://t.co/KY1144zCdk

To be clear Wisconsin has received $2 billion in federal COVID relief funds & the Governor has used $1.9 billion of that.   We need more federal dollars for states like Wisconsin to survive.   But we also need our state leaders to take action.  Be safe stay home & wear a mask.

As of yesterday Wisconsin had 254 full-time contact tracers hired at the state level.    894 full-time at the local level.  1148 full-time contact tracers in total.  Modeling shows we need 6000-31000.   Meanwhile we have 75580 active COVID cases.  We’re not doing enough.

Wisconsin recorded 6635 new COVID cases & 83 new deaths today.  We need the state legislature & governor to come together and take action to protect all Wisconsinites.  Wisconsin has 1.6% of the U.S. population.  But we're 7th in the country for COVID cases.  This is urgent.

After moving my mom to a new nursing home last Monday she tested positive for COVID on Tues from a previous test.  I wore a mask while moving her have quarantined since & tested negative myself on Fri.  Neither of us is symptomatic & she's doing well.  Stay home wear a mask. https://t.co/WCn98wXfFD
Over 125000 people in America have died from COVID since then. https://t.co/vactGEufGZ

7073 new COVID cases in Wisconsin today.  291 new hospitalizations.  66 new deaths.  7-day positivity rate is 36%.  Please wear a mask. Stay home if you can. Avoid large groups.   We need URGENT action from federal state & local government to get this crisis under control.

Over 10000000 COVID cases in the U.S.  Over 238000 Americans dead.  Over 130000000 Americans live with pre-existing conditions.  And the @GOP & @realDonaldTrump are at the Supreme Court today trying to end the Affordable Care Act.
Holding superspreader rallies as 237000+ Americans have died from COVID because you’re a sore loser is truly reprehensible. https://t.co/6sHYkdzxyA

5922 new cases on Thursday.  6141 new cases on Friday.  7065 new cases today.  Three straight record-setting days.  Wisconsin this pandemic is very real.  Wear a mask. Please stay home if you can. Avoid large crowds. Social distance.   Please be safe. https://t.co/RARya1ApVR

Wisconsin topped 6000 new COVID cases today—a new record.  244 new hospitalizations.   A 33% 7-day positivity rate.  This crisis won't be ignored away.   Wear a mask. Social distance. Avoid large gatherings. Stay home if you can.  Wisconsinites please take this seriously.
Wisconsin had almost 6000 new COVID cases yesterday.  Wear a mask.  Social distance.  No parties.  No anti-science lawsuits.

Wisconsin we have >225000 COVID cases >2000 deaths & a 29.5% 7-day positivity rate.  It's time to end partisan politics end government inaction & end selfish behavior.  Everyone must act together with the urgency this crisis deserves.  My latest column:https://t.co/o1QvET74zP
America can thank President Trump for 30000+ COVID cases & 700+ deaths linked to his superspreader rallies. https://t.co/xVYRuTRCFk
Don't let @realDonaldTrump tell you more tests are why we have more COVID cases.  His own former FDA commissioner debunks that.  We are not rounding the corner. https://t.co/hqZT9svT9B
The 7-day average of COVID-19 cases in Wisconsin is over 4000.  5096 new cases reported today.  Why on earth is Donald Trump holding a superspreader rally here right now? https://t.co/SpPdoh5JjR

Trump in Wisconsin—where we had 5262 new COVID cases 64 deaths & and a 31.8% positivity rate TODAY—downplaying COVID. https://t.co/xzIEeeYXCP

5262 new COVID cases today.  64 new deaths.  31.8% positivity rate—meaning almost 1 in 3 people tested tested positive.  Wisconsin we can only beat this if we work together: ✅Wear a mask ✅Social distance ✅No parties/large gatherings ✅No anti-science lawsuits
The President started this month testing positive for COVID-19 and is finishing it claiming he ended a global pandemic. https://t.co/EF7WjX0wUI
